title: IRESS Ltd (ASX:IRE) (Q2 2025) Earnings Call Highlights: Strong Revenue Growth and Strategic ...
description: IRESS Ltd (ASX:IRE) reports robust revenue growth and strategic initiatives amid ongoing restructuring efforts.
content:
• Adjusted EBITDA: $60.2 million, up 8.7% with margins improving by 42 basis points to 24.1%.
• Net Profit After Tax (NPAT): $17.3 million, in line with the previous year.
• Underlying Earnings Per Share (EPS): $0.176 per share, up 19%.
• R&D Investment: Increased, with R&D CapEx at 5% of revenue.
• Stranded Cost Savings: Targeting $12 million to $16 million over the next two years.

For the complete transcript of the earnings call, please refer to the full earnings call transcript.
• IRESS Ltd (ASX:IRE) reported a 6.8% increase in revenue for the first half of 2025, driven by strong performance in trading and UK businesses.
• Adjusted EBITDA rose by 8.7% to $60.2 million, with margins improving by 42 basis points to 24.1%.
• The company declared an interim dividend of $0.11 per share, 50% franked, reflecting confidence in its financial position.
• Recurring revenue remains robust at over 94%, providing a stable and reliable income stream.
• IRESS Ltd (ASX:IRE) has a strong client retention rate, with more than 90% of its top 20 clients having been with the company for over a decade.
• The company is undergoing a stranded cost program to reduce corporate costs by $12 million to $16 million over the next two years, indicating ongoing restructuring needs.
• Operating costs increased by 6.2%, partly due to adverse currency effects and increased R&D investment.
• The APAC Wealth segment experienced a revenue decline due to a client restructure in mid-2024.
• The divestment of certain businesses has impacted overall adjusted EBITDA, which was down 3.9% to $64.4 million.
• There is uncertainty around the timeline and revenue impact of new AI-driven products, with significant benefits expected only in the longer term (2028-2030).

Q: Can you provide an update on the restructuring and volume churn in the Australian wealth business? A: Marcus Price, CEO: The restructuring was a one-off effect due to a client restructure in the second half of 2024. The underlying wealth business has grown in terms of its footprint, and we do not foresee any further restructuring. The business has now stabilized, and we expect growth from this new baseline.

The company's Adjusted EBITDA rose by 8.7% to $60.2 million, with margins improving by 42 basis points to 24.1%. Net Profit After Tax (NPAT) was $17.3 million, in line with the previous year. R&D Investment increased, with CapEx at 5% of revenue. The firm declared an interim dividend of $0.11 per share, 50% franked, reflecting confidence in its financial position.
shortSummary: IRESS Ltd reported a 6.8% revenue increase, improved margins, and a significant investment program to reduce corporate costs, despite challenges in its Australian wealth business.
argos_summary: IRESS Ltd (ASX:IRE) reported a 6.8% revenue increase for H1 2025, with adjusted EBITDA rising 8.7% to $60.2 million and margins improving. The company declared an interim dividend of $0.11 per share and maintains a strong recurring revenue rate of over 94%. However, operating costs increased due to currency effects and higher R&D investments, while the APAC Wealth segment faced a revenue decline from a client restructure. IRESS is targeting stranded cost savings of $12 million to $16 million over the next two years as part of its ongoing restructuring efforts.
